text:
Question 129) Portuguese Language Museum. Oswald de Andrade: The guilty of everything. 27 set. 2011 to 29 Jan. 2012. SÃ£o Paulo: Prol Graphic, 2012.
Oswald de Andrade's poem dates back to the idea that Brazilianness is related to football. Regarding the issue of national identity, the notes around the verses constitute
A) Possible directions for a critical reading of historical-cultural data.
B) classic form of Brazilian poetic construction.
C) rejection of Brazil's idea as the country of football.
D) interventions of a foreign reader in the exercise of poetic reading.
E) Reminders of typically Brazilian replacement words of the originals.
